case.name: Black & Decker Inc v GMCA Pty Ltd (No 5) [2008] FCA 1738 (20 November 2008)

citphrases.citphrase: power saw able to be used as either panel saw or jigsaw patents
whether retrospective operation of licence agreement designs
infringement by fraudulent or obvious imitation
overhead costs of infringer whether deductible in determining profits
composite product wether profit on sale of whole or of part.
deduction where expert witness fees in excess of scale rate
whether court should otherwise order under federal court rules o 62 r 36a given judgment less than $100,000

citances.sentence: 7 Black & Decker elected to take an account of profits, which were duly assessed at $77,275.10: Black & Decker Inc v GMCA Pty Ltd (No 5) [2008] FCA 1738. Under O 62 r 36A where a party is awarded judgment for less than $100,000 for a money sum or damages any costs ordered to be paid will be "reduced by one-third of the amount otherwise allowable under this Order unless the Court or a Judge otherwise orders". A gross sum would be an amount "allowable" under O 62.
